pr_title: Add SpongeImplHook for entity reach distance (#2513)

timeline.message: Add SpongeImplHook for entity reach distance (#2513)

timeline.bodyText:
I'm actually not really sure about "adding (removing)" this straight up. It feels to me that this was intended to work as a way to ensure "line of sight" for an interaction. The removal of this check means that I could, in theory, reach though a few blocks to interact with a switch on the other side, when I don't think that's intended.
I don't think this "fix" is correct and that the real bug is client side. I can see hack clients possibly making use of this to activate things though walls and such.
timeline.author: dualspiral

replies.bodyText:
This line of sight check is only applied to interactions with entities, not blocks.
If you look at the bug description on Mojang's tracker, they talk about this exact if-statement.
Imagine this scenario. You are using a mob farm, where you 1) need to click at mobs' legs, while mobs are standing above you by 1 block, 2) there's a block that blocks line of sight between you and mobs' eyes, 3) you need to stand back 4 blocks (for one reason or another).
What happens is when you do the click - interaction only happens client-side. E.g. if you name a mob in that situation - you'll get a "ghost empty slot" in place of the name tag and a mob that shows a name but doesn't have one.
Again, this check only works on entities, as blocks are handled in a separate method.
replies.author: PolyacovYury

replies.bodyText: It's the same principle though. Should this line of sight check be removed for these entity checks? I'm not convinced that it's a server bug, but a client one - the client is what is causing the ghosting.
replies.author: dualspiral

replies.bodyText:
Well, the only thing line of sight check does is it halves the distance the player can reach that entity from.
And remember, it doesn't check if player sees entity's hitbox. It checks if player sees entity's eye point.
replies.author: PolyacovYury

replies.bodyText:
I know what it does.
My point is that the bug seems to be client side to me (the client ignores the fact this check exists) rather than this check exists in the first place. If we were to "fix" this, it really should be checking to see if we can see the hitbox rather than removing the check altogether, the check is clearly there for a reason. This is why I'm not sure we should accept this.
replies.author: dualspiral
PolyacovYury

timeline.bodyText: So I went ahead and looked at the Forge patch for this class and this is not one of the changes they make, d0 = 36.0D here is left alone. Why should we change the behaviour away from Forge here?
timeline.author: dualspiral

replies.bodyText:
Because there was this PR - MinecraftForge/MinecraftForge#4736 - that was headed at exactly this issue. Without the change the player sees that they can reach that entity, they swing the sword and.. nothing happens.
That PR wasn't even properly discussed - just staled and closed due to inactivity.
replies.author: PolyacovYury

timeline.message: Don't fix vanilla issue in a PR that isn't aimed at a vanilla issue
